poem:
### Reading the Meter

Before the rise  
of numbers—  
the click and whirr,  
each digit a coin  
spun on copper,  
frozen in time—  
lift the latch,  
speak the language  
of dials  
to avoid the dimming  
of your brightened  
days.  
Your fingers cradle  
the silent story  
of homes untouched  
by unseen  
increments.
